types1:Item.types1:Name: Alert_Configuration_Manager
types1:Item.types1:Description: This guide provides set of tools to manage, generate and test Fault Alert Service Configuration

avosScreenflow.name: Alert_Configuration_Manager
avosScreenflow.description: This guide provides set of tools to manage, generate and test Fault Alert Service Configuration

screen.title: Welcome
screen.body:
Alert Configuration Management Tool

Use this guide to configure and test Fault Alert Service Rules.

This Service allows to apply declarative Alert Rules and flexibplem framework to use any of the built-in or custom Actions

Features

  • Declarative extensible configuration providers (currently supports http get, github gist, gitlab snippets)
  • Declarative rules to route message to specific actions with flexibility to add custom actions (event triggers via JMS,AWS SQS, Kafka)
  • Declarative actions - currently supported ignore/email
  • Ability to save/read configuration in xml on simple http get provider or github gist or bitbucket snippets or similar snippet storage, other config and action providers should be possible to develop via connectors
  • Guide based configuration manager

 URN mappings used by the Alert Handler Service 

URN

URL Example

Required

Description

ae:base-uri

https://na1.ai.dm-us.informaticacloud.com

Yes

Base URI ICAI POD used to generate links to process Instance

urn:environment:name

iclab

Yes

Environment Name must match the Agent Name or Cloud Server

urn:environment:orgid

d8UL5i5Pm4KddufpfKuiaN

Yes

Environment ORG ID

urn:ic:faultAlerts:configuration:provider

gist

No

Configuration Storage provider (Default is gist and supported values are gist,gitlab,url)

urn:ic:faultAlerts:configuration:url

URL

Yes

Configuration URL is either gist raw URL, absolute file path to file or simply http/https URL

urn:ic:faultAlerts:fallback:email

jbrazda@informatica.com

Yes

Fallback Email used when configuration fails to load. This should be a distribution list email.

screen.title: Save As
screen.body:
Alert Handler Service can retrieve  configuration from following locations

  • Github Gist
  • Gitlab Snippet
  • Web Server URL using get 

You can generate Configuration as XML and upload it manually to Your Storage provider or directly 

Save As

screen.title: Test Tool
screen.body:
Alert Service Testing Tool

This tool allows to test current environment Configuration parameters based on URN mapping stored on the Secure Agent URN 

  • Test against pre-defined Sample Payload
  • Test against arbitrary pasted payload

<type>equals</type> <value>SP-Test-Throw-Fault-Generic</value> <not>false</not> <alert-field>processName</alert-field> </condition> <condition> <guid>981275e6-2328-4294-982d-be85eba32577</guid> <type>matches</type> <value>.*Test.*</value> <not/> <alert-field>processName</alert-field> </condition> <condition> <guid>e14d31b1-cb2f-419b-9770-b69ebc08000d</guid> <type>matches</type> <value>SP-Test-.*</value> <not>false</not> <alert-field>processName</alert-field> </condition> <condition> <guid>70177f72-7ee5-42e6-b2d0-816fba957303</guid> <type>contains</type> <value>Test</value> <not>false</not> <alert-field>processName</alert-field> </condition> <action> <guid>f419969c-f9f1-4994-8c66-d6710f4d4625</guid> <Name>Ignore Alert</Name> <Type>ignore</Type> </action> </rule> <rule> <rule> <guid>{util:generateUUID()}</guid> <operator>OR</operator> <name>New Rule</name> </rule>

<action> <Name>New Action</Name> <Description>Please Describe the Action</Description> <Type>email-action</Type> <ActionDetail> <action-email> <subject>Error - Uncaught Fault Alert</subject> <to></to> <cc></cc> <bcc></bcc> <contentType>text/html</contentType> <actionName>Send Alert Email</actionName> </action-email> </ActionDetail> <guid>{util:generateUUID()}</guid> </action>

let $errors := {if (not(empty($temp.tmp_action ))) then () else You have to select Action to edit it} let $message := if (empty($errors/error)) then () else
    { for $error in $errors/error return
  • {$error/text()}
    • }
let $messageHtml := if (empty($message)) then () else util:toXML($message) return $messageHtml

let $saxon_params := <xsl:output xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" xmlns:saxon="http://saxon.sf.net/" method="xml" omit-xml-declaration="yes" indent="yes" saxon:indent-spaces="4"/> return (:pretty print, indent xml for display , simplifyXml removes unused namespaces which were added while copying, cloning elements:) saxon:serialize(util:simplifyXml($temp.tmp_action[1]/ActionDetail/*), $saxon_params)

let $errors := {if (not(empty($temp.tmp_action[1]/Name ))) then () else Action Name field is required } {if (not(empty($temp.tmp_action[1]/Type ))) then () else Type field is required} let $message := if (empty($errors/error)) then () else
    { for $error in $errors/error return
  • {$error/text()}
    • }
let $messageHtml := if (empty($message)) then () else util:toXML($message) return $messageHtml
contains(lower-case($temp.tmp_action[1]/Type),"email")

if (not(empty($temp.tmp_action[1]/ActionDetail/* ))) then $temp.tmp_action[1]/ActionDetail/* else <action-email> <subject>Error - Uncaught Fault Alert</subject> <to></to> <cc></cc> <bcc></bcc> <contentType>text/html</contentType> <actionName>Send Alert Email</actionName> </action-email>

let $emailAction := $temp.tmp_email_action[1] let $errors := {if (not(empty($emailAction/actionName/text()))) then () else Email Action Name field is required } {if (not(empty($emailAction/to/text() | $emailAction/bcc/text() | $emailAction/cc/text() ))) then () else At Least one of recipient fields is required (to/cc/bcc)} {if (not(empty($emailAction/subject/text()))) then () else Subject field is Required} {if (not(empty($emailAction/contentType/text()))) then () else Subject field is Required} let $message := if (empty($errors/error)) then () else
    { for $error in $errors/error return
  • {$error/text()}
    • }
let $messageHtml := if (empty($message)) then () else util:toXML($message) return $messageHtml

{util:simplifyXml($temp.tmp_email_action )}
</action-email>

let $saxon_params :=<xsl:output xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" xmlns:saxon="http://saxon.sf.net/" method="xml" omit-xml-declaration="yes" indent="yes" saxon:indent-spaces="4"/> return (:pretty print, indent xml for display , simplifyXml removes unused namespaces which were added while copying, cloning elements:) saxon:serialize(util:simplifyXml($temp.tmp_alert_configuration), $saxon_params)

util:parseXML($temp.tmp_test_fault_xml )

let $sample_payload := <AlertDetails> <processId>14510</processId> <processName>SP-Test-Throw-Fault-Generic</processName> <faultNamespace>http://schemas.informatica.com/spi/types/2013/12/spi-interface/</faultNamespace> <processInitiator>jbrazda-iics@informatica.com</processInitiator> <faultDetails><fault hasElementData="true" hasMessageData="false" name="faultResponse" namespaceURI="http://schemas.informatica.com/spi/types/2013/12/spi-interface/" rethrowable="true" source="/process/flow/scope[@name='Throw_with_parameters']/sequence/throw[@name='Throw_with_parameters']" suspendable="true"><aetgt:faultResponse xmlns:aetgt="http://schemas.informatica.com/spi/types/2013/12/spi-interface/" xmlns:type="http://schemas.informatica.com/spi/types/2013/12/spi-interface/"><sf:code xmlns:sf="http://schemas.active-endpoints.com/appmodules/screenflow/2010/10/avosScreenflow.xsd">500</sf:code><sf:reason xmlns:sf="http://schemas.active-endpoints.com/appmodules/screenflow/2010/10/avosScreenflow.xsd">Test</sf:reason><sf:details xmlns:sf="http://schemas.active-endpoints.com/appmodules/screenflow/2010/10/avosScreenflow.xsd">Test Fault Detail</sf:details></aetgt:faultResponse></fault></faultDetails> <processNamespace>urn:screenflow:process:SP-Test-Throw-Fault-Generic</processNamespace> <locationPath>/process/flow/scope[@name='Throw_with_parameters']/sequence/throw[@name='Throw_with_parameters']</locationPath> <status>faulting</status> <faultName>faultResponse</faultName> </AlertDetails> return util:toXML($sample_payload)
